page.title: 04CARNIVAL WEEK
page.content: Carnival week is the first week of August. All through the week there are celebrations. All the money raised goes to the Village Hall to pay for the up-keep of it. There are coffee mornings and jumble sales. In the Carnival Procession there are lots of floats like "The Old Woman who Lived in the Shoe." We have a Carnival Queen, Princess and four attendants. I was once an attendant. We lead the procession. We go twice around the Village; while we go around people throw money on to the floats. After they have gone round twice there is a disco on the School Field. There are hot-dogs and games, lots of drinks and food. There is a man who puts on dancing music. The disco finishes at 10 o'clock. It's always a lovely Carnival Week. NICOLA.
